content.question: When pellets of <math alttext="N a O H solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> are added to a flask of water, it is observed that the temperature of the water increases as the pellets dissolve. Which of the following claims about the observed dissolution of <math alttext="N a O H solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> in water is most accurate?

choices.label: It is an endothermic process because heat energy is absorbed by the water as the <math alttext="N a O H solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> dissolves in it.

It is an endothermic process because heat energy is released by the water as the <math alttext="N a O H solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> dissolves in it.

It is an exothermic process because heat energy is absorbed by the water as the <math alttext="N a O H solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> dissolves in it.

It is an exothermic process because heat energy is released by the water as the <math alttext="N a O H solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> dissolves in it.

content.answer: It is an exothermic process because heat energy is absorbed by the water as the <math alttext="N a O H solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> dissolves in it.
